byline.original: By NATHANIEL POPPER and MICHAEL CORKERY

lead_paragraph: A recommendation from an advocate of stronger rules on Wall Street asks investors to vote on whether to study the benefits of breaking the banks up.

headline.print_headline: Investors in 2 Big Banks Asked to Study Split-Ups
headline.main: Proposal at JPMorgan and Citigroup Raises Prospect of Split-Up

snippet: A recommendation from an advocate of stronger rules on Wall Street asks investors to vote on whether to study the benefits of breaking the banks up.
abstract: Financial policy advocate Bartlett Naylor is asking JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup shareholders to consider breaking up banks as way to give investors more choice and control; question is expected to be on annual proxy filings and then put up for vote.
